I think it's much clearer if the scheduler is independent of the optimization (as is now), since its name suggests it only schedules the learning rates. and it also gives you the freedom to use it anywhere in the code depending on the scheduling you want.

Maybe if the method was renamed to scheduler.update() or scheduler.update_lr() things could be clearer.

I think it's much clearer if the scheduler is independent of the optimization (as is now), since its name suggests it only schedules the learning rates. and it also gives you the freedom to use it anywhere in the code depending on the scheduling you want.

Maybe if the method was renamed to scheduler.update() or scheduler.update_lr() things could be clearer.
